On a happy note that's some beautiful spaghetti

Yeah, Riot's templates have been leaking all over the place, like in ult pings with a "champions in range: x, y, z" thing. I wonder if these bugs will show up in Worlds play. "Doublefake is still stacking his Ultimate Hunter minor rune, and now he's checking it to see which target to prioritize, so... oh. It's broken. AWKWARD!"
I'd love for this to happen during a live event.
Calm down there, Satan.
So I guess you want this big to be fixed? Just think about this: Will fixing the bug generate money? No? -> No fix but more skins. Yes? -> Gets fixed.

I mean, that's not how it works. So first you need to reproduce the issue, find where in the code the issue is coming from, and then figure out how to fix it. As someone who works in QA, the first part can be surprisingly hard. Meanwhile each bug takes manpower and time to fix, and each bug is not equal in severity. Bugs that actually affect gameplay for example, tend to be higher in the queue to fix. If there are other issues that need the work and time more than a simple text bug, that's the biggest case of other things getting put to the side and lasting multiple patches.

> [{quoted}](name=Academy Kayn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=LE1s9nRW,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2019-09-27T18:23:15.512+0000)
>
> I mean, that's not how it works. So first you need to reproduce the issue, find where in the code the issue is coming from, and then figure out how to fix it. As someone who works in QA, the first part can be surprisingly hard. Meanwhile each bug takes manpower and time to fix, and each bug is not equal in severity. Bugs that actually affect gameplay for example, tend to be higher in the queue to fix. If there are other issues that need the work and time more than a simple text bug, that's the biggest case of other things getting put to the side and lasting multiple patches.

i have written code. this is a problem with someone not printing a display properly. There are 3 reasons this happens. reason 1 is that the person typing the code didn't put a quotation or parenthesis in the right place, reason 2 is that the person who created the variable @F whatever coded the box to show the variable instead of the print statement, or they're using a language that doesn't ignore white space.

That's very true, but for some reason, some people are getting this issue, some aren't, and as I've seen from at least one person, sometimes it happens, and sometime it doesn't. You're likely far better at guessing what the cause may be for that, as I've not a clue. But from what I can gather, something is likely interfering with something to cause one of those reasons.

> [{quoted}](name=Academy Kayn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=LE1s9nRW,comment-id=0006000000000000,timestamp=2019-09-27T20:22:43.661+0000)
>
> That's very true, but for some reason, some people are getting this issue, some aren't, and as I've seen from at least one person, sometimes it happens, and sometime it doesn't. You're likely far better at guessing what the cause may be for that, as I've not a clue. But from what I can gather, something is likely interfering with something to cause one of those reasons.

it could be an issue with networking then. are you aware of the issue that causes abyssal mask to appear in tft? I'm pretty sure that the cause for it is due to dropped packets. If it's only happening to some players and not all then the bug is probably on the data transfer side. I've had the "@F" bug too and I can say with certainty that my connection while stable does run into issues because my laptop overheats or I Alt Tab a lot - especially during load in.

In the past this has caused visual issues and rendering issues. So maybe it's during that initial load in that players are disconnecting and then the UI never fully updates.

It's either a bad conception "Spaghetti code" , it always seemed to me that riot was not very fond of the KISS principle.
Or a change in the back system that made this feature incompatible.

The later looks to be the most probable since their engineer are trying to fix the code from ground up , but are in a struggle because they can't just remake the game entierely, they have to work one part at the time.

Hey @Rito TDD aint a goiod way to program on a big scale.
